description: When you don't have a meat grinder, a knife or food processor will do the job. A finely chopped or ground paste of assorted meat, fat, gristle, and connective tissues.
//: Nutrition information based on 70 percent lean ground beef. Source USDA. 454g or 1 pound is a common package size.

description: Finely chopped or ground scraps of meat.
//: Nutrition information based on 70 percent lean ground beef. Source USDA. 454g or 1 pound is a common package size. 1 scrap = 1/10 of a chunk.

description: Meat that has been ground then formed into strips or sticks and smoked or dehydrated. Chewier than regular jerky but with a shorter shelf life.
Minced or ground meat, and optionally filler or other ingredients, mushed into a ball. It can be used as a substitute for chunks of meat, or formed into smaller balls for use in sauces and soups.
